scores_description.1: Main idea is not linked to central topic.
scores_description.2: Main idea is linked to central topic but there is no topic sentence to bring ideas together.
scores_description.3: Main idea is linked to central topic and there is a topic sentence that states some aspect of the content.
scores_description.4: Main idea is linked to central topic and has a topic sentence that states the main idea.

scores_description.1: Statements are not related to the passage.
scores_description.2: Some key information from the passage is included, but important ideas are missing.
scores_description.3: Most key information from the passage is included, but some ideas may be irrelevant or inaccurate.
scores_description.4: All key information in the passage is included without irrelevant ideas.

scores_description.1: Ideas are randomly presented and do not link to each other.
scores_description.2: Some ideas link to each other.

scores_description.1: The language used is not objective.
scores_description.2: Some of the language used is objective.
scores_description.3: Most of the language used is objective.
scores_description.4: All of the language used is objective.

scores_description.1: Summary shows a heavy reliance on verbatim copying of source language.
scores_description.2: Summary shows some use of original wording, but there are examples of verbatim or near-copy of source language.
scores_description.3: Summary shows evidence of appropriate levels of paraphrasing.
scores_description.4: Summary shows substantial evidence of appropriate paraphrasing use.

scores_description.3: Summary shows an appropriate range of lexical and syntactic structures.
scores_description.4: Summary shows an excellent range of lexical and syntactic structures.
